tweets.text:
Following the fire at a former waste site in #Telford last week our officers are also monitoring the #RiverSevern from south #Shrewsbury to north of #Gloucester to check for any environmental impacts

#Shropshire @TelfordWrekin @PHE_WestMids @shropsfire https://t.co/wb94TEmA0K

We're continuing to support our partners @shropsfire @WMerciaPolice @HighwaysWMIDS @TelfordWrekin @PHE_WestMids with the fire at a former waste site in Wellington #Telford 

Our officers are also monitoring the water quality downstream of the fire for impacts on the environment https://t.co/ENwOSBKpoz

@EnvAgencyMids So, I'm assuming that as they've   started tipping fresh waste again, that they have a functional gas management system that is in use, & effectively operating to minimise the odour from landfill gases? Yes? No? Or don't you know..? #StopTheStink

It‚Äôs been a long and difficult 24 hours... #CSIoftheSea examination on the Thames minke whale about to get underway with @OfficialZSL and @ZSLScience team, great collective effort by many in helping with the recovery. More to follow https://t.co/7fw5aTftKE

@LukeTaylorLD @SimonJonesStH @plumeplotter @pippamaslin @Ikf77 @Mrploemic @ChrisSt49518430 @harryhpalmer @chiefdynamo @DaveDwyer15 @mikelewis10 @sharon_weddell How does the "recycling" turn up at the incinerator? How is the bottom ash taken away?

While the extra NO2 from the chimneys isn't great, it's CO, SO2 & VOC that is causing all the @EnvAgency breaches.

@MarkGale @SimonJonesStH @plumeplotter @pippamaslin @Ikf77 @Mrploemic @ChrisSt49518430 @harryhpalmer @chiefdynamo @DaveDwyer15 @mikelewis10 @sharon_weddell It's worth noting that the background NO2 levels in the area are approximately 31mg/m3, with the incinerator contributing a max of 4.7 (above?) that. The levels are much more impacted by road vehicles than the incinerator. https://t.co/MBevVa8kQQ https://t.co/luPYl1JcJF

Even if you don't live near a river you could be at risk from other sources of #flooding & need to consider #PFR to protect your property üíß 

Check if you‚Äôre at risk from other types of flooding here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/bpmkttq3Lx @EnvAgencyNW 

#floodaware #floodreilience #flooding https://t.co/MfMtO54knH

urls.title: | Environment Agency Board Member
urls.description: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs Environment, Food & Rural Affairs D irector of Floods and Water, Defra ‚Ä¢ Departmental Official Chair, Environment Agency ‚Ä¢ Representative of Organisation Chair, Highways England ‚Ä¢ Independent Member ‚Ä¢ sets the strategy, drives performance and holds the organisation to account; ‚Ä¢ provides stewardship for public funds and environmental outcomes. The Board is made up of a Chair, Chief Executive and up to 14 other members. The Board has a collegiate style. It
